F162C1CAD18C4DC7B7E5B554C0C7BBF6.description: emonstrate appropriate strategies to provide feedback that is a positive reflection of a presentation and/or encourages the presenter and audience to consider other ideas and additional information; e.g., I like it when you said ..., you may want to consider ...

D6265C18E0714F3885DB15B875DE362F.description: use appropriate criteria and teamwork tools to assess and monitor group processes; e.g., checklists, role descriptors, flow charts, discussion and questions

9FCE0D2F8E264A3D8FF10D0E42A6B794.description: engage in effective evaluations by realizing the importance of tact, honesty and specificity in peer and self-evaluation

69B5AE50D2D14BDF9233413C38C804B2.description: identify and apply appropriate leadership styles to motivate a group; e.g., be cooperative and supportive and use appropriate problem-solving strategies

D0F1AF49EDE040CDAD813E9099434AEF.description: recognize the various roles and responsibilities of group members, e.g., recorder, chair, Elder and coworker, and appreciate the contribution that these roles make to the group process

D85F2BA029484033BF201ADC1D115C09.description: demonstrate listening and other appropriate behaviours within a group; e.g., listen without interrupting, focus on the speaker, contribute to be heard, disagree courteously, accept conflicting opinions, show respect for the rights and values of others

7165031A6A8546E19D78D9403554785D.description: use an appropriate conflict-resolution model to identify and clarify the conflict, recognize different points of view, generate solutions, implement the best solution and assess the results

09234156E277403E9369BF3C54B8D8A4.description: participate effectively as a group member to facilitate the completion of group goals; e.g., generate ideas, access resources, contribute abilities and interests, monitor progress and share responsibility for completion

FB2C792316694180A25567A211027A08.description: interact and communicate with others in a positive manner, by considering appropriate dress, space and conversational skills; e.g., when in a job interview, when communicating with a customer or coworker

21DC5E368C12481BA439B37555335218.description: demonstrate respect for, and assess and defend, individual rights and differences in themselves and others, within a group or a community, in a positive and constructive manner; e.g., be fair and honest, demonstrate integrity and personal ethics

52E660589DE94606BF86DAB7B0584E3F.description: set appropriate personal goals for participation in a group, e.g., demonstrate respect and be open to and supportive of the thoughts, opinions and contributions of others, and share personal knowledge, expertise and perspectives, as appropriate

0AEDCC2EF04B4C62B1E4F572BE2F3BBD.description: Cooperate with others and contribute to group processes

56E406CF7681476FBCE7550F0A29013A.description: identify the formal and informal ways in which language and image are used appropriately to honour and/or recognize people and celebrate events; e.g., a toast, eulogy, poster and thank-you card

D5A437DC5E49436C955874A9F95B2737.description: use language and image to honour and/or recognize their own and others' accomplishments; e.g., construct e-mail and other messages conveying congratulations, thank-you notes

13B136643E6D4F75A5A967329D38AC29.description: examine the ways in which selected works of literature, and other print and nonprint texts, influence individual and group values and behaviours

FC4AF830FCC047BD9A8AACE29ED6C643.description: demonstrate an appreciation for diversity of thought and expression and select, monitor and modify, as needed, appropriate strategies for appreciating diversity

2C34C24D93F943A28184E8D13F3C6ABC.description: recognize and demonstrate respect for diversity, individual differences and perspectives

A9BE7FE2D50F4DFCB6E6D7B8F92F0206.description: Appreciate diversity of expression, opinion and perspective

234E3779F4914AAE9A424E69879BAB6C.description: monitor the use of verbal and nonverbal communication to convey inclusion, respect and consideration

FBE6C9BD87AB4972BDB8D76CEAC2450C.description: differentiate between constructive criticism and ridicule, and between irony and sarcasm, and use appropriate strategies to show respect

A21D8790B0144F2E80FA876B616E3C9B.description: recognize positive and negative portrayals of persons in life and characters in literature and demonstrate sensitivity to the feelings of others

2D5407F4A48F41ABA4F095AAAFA6B352.description: use inclusive language and behaviour and communicate or create texts in ways that demonstrate respect for people of different heritage, cultures, genders, ages, abilities, opinions and communities, including aboriginal people and communities

295774337DE24F2F92B492D378415001.description: Use language and image to show respect and consideration

1DC92A8DB06B46CE88220980AC32035E.description: Respect themselves and others and strengthen community

2B7D12ED64884ABD965CE7A05C31772E.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

BF2112C5ECDE4FA6BAF0806E610B14E3.description: recognize that certain communication situations demand particular attention to correctness of punctuation, spelling, grammar, usage and sentence construction; e.g., résumés, application forms and letters, job interviews

62E89DF3213A465FB040A90F438D2D36.description: identify the parts of speech in their own and others' texts, e.g., nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs, to ensure correct subject-verb agreement, pronoun use and sentence structure

007588BE86694FCB8395C1587600C1EC.description: identify parts of sentences and common sentence structures, e.g., simple, compound and complex, and use transitional devices, as appropriate, to correct common errors in sentences; e.g., run-on sentences and fragments

70C51E1918474776B5470393EBD377F4.description: apply basic capitalization, punctuation and spelling conventions, using appropriate tools; e.g., dictionaries, handbooks and spelling software/technology

409226F236D347C59587A38965A653A1.description: revise texts to ensure clarity and coherence; e.g., editing for punctuation, spelling, usage, grammar, sentence structure, paragraph transitions, transitional devices, style and vocabulary

F659EEFD4E084A6EA1FA4F0A2A8CB3B7.description: use appropriate tools to assist in creating and revising text; e.g., handbooks, exemplars, models, dictionaries and spell checks/grammar checks on word processors

A67A6C74A26246CC9EA66B53E202A64D.description: Edit text for matters of correctness

D6AC113E131A4EB28CD8C7E8020604FE.description: demonstrate self-direction, self-discipline and the ability to work independently and effectively to improve products and/or presentations

56CA94964B364623B7E7C3BF9EDE38D6.description: select and use the effective techniques, elements and matters of choice appropriate to the purpose, audience and medium; e.g., vocabulary, expressions, sentence patterns and structures, illustrations, artwork and Internet links

6D2F21C896704CBAA98B39027E7821AA.description: Consider and address matters of choice

86E755397559432C9FF1F3BC0C80CF73.description: manipulate graphics and text to effectively communicate a topic

EEF1C5F5B9864A9C8FE1C16C90CB886F.description: assess the closing of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider plan, purpose, audience and medium and to ensure an appropriate conclusion

C3A58AFB2EC145EEA35C306B8FF6D7F3.description: review the organizational components of a text in progress to strengthen the effectiveness of the components as units of thought or experience; e.g., paragraphs in a letter of application, components of a résumés or sections/slides in a multimedia presentation

B3C8D2CE7B33478DAB07CEC480C2A73C.description: assess the beginning of a text in progress and revise as needed to consider the plan, purpose, audience and medium

0B51F70E3B8A41E5BCEA8B40DDAB9341.description: create, enhance and evaluate the effectiveness of a variety of presentation forms; e.g., written/oral reports, posters, multimedia presentations, charts, collages, cartoons and Web pages

03120C9B4F2A4BB9920969197719B98C.description: demonstrate responsibility for following appropriate security and safety measures when using technology and the Internet; e.g., use appropriate language and etiquette, apply ergonomics to promote personal health and well-being and respect the products and privacy of others

968D4E2EB0134ABA98F9F1D5B161371B.description: review the accuracy and specificity of details, events, images, facts and other data intended to support a focus, controlling idea or issue and add information to support/develop as needed

021D190E6F3B47038CCB34FD3225F26B.description: confirm the controlling idea or desired unifying effect of a text

2F0B8D636EBD486FB4AEE6A7083A6819.description: Enhance thought, understanding, support and detail

3FF53FCC42FF45D78B38B09E8574D1EA.description: Improve thoughtfulness, effectiveness and correctness of communication

6D483A2EC3AC45CC9CE511409B516819.description: use a consistent style when crediting sources of information in a bibliography and in footnotes

99AEA3605B9841ED9866328B1AF426C7.description: demonstrate a moral and ethical approach in the use of graphics, text and multimedia in presentations by citing sources as appropriate

724875191B5A467A81929E0BC43E4594.description: demonstrate appropriate keyboarding techniques, e.g., use proper fingering when using alphabet and punctuation keys, and use a variety of strategies to increase keyboarding speed and accuracy

B3BA194849AE41B9A341E6CE7D054324.description: control aspects of style, e.g., font, size, style, colour, spacing of text, image placement, sound and video links, within the presentation form or product for consistency and/or to convey meaning

531C0D5FCFA14B1AA82AF8CE03A59228.description: develop and deliver oral, visual and multimedia presentations, using voice production factors, nonverbal factors, e.g., tone, volume, eye contact, gestures and posture, and visual production factors, e.g., colour, contrast and movement, appropriate to the purpose, audience and situation

114ED1C737C445EDBD36720087EE04A9.description: create presentations by integrating information gathered from various sources; e.g., use various audio and visual technologies and a variety of software, applying appropriate common conventions

AB73A310D36C4F4EA5156419A2CBF4AA.description: create presentations and select strategies and technologies appropriate to the environment, purpose, audience and form and recognize the need for preparedness in effective communication

F52F1A5CB06040EEBA98F3768E2BABF4.description: Use production, publication and presentation strategies and technologies consistent with context

1173A2526C104C61BBC4F42834C98531.description: create a variety of print, oral, visual and/or multimedia texts that reflect a controlling idea, focus, purpose and audience, including: functional writing, e.g., an advertisement for a newspaper, résumés, cover letter, business letter, using electronic templates as appropriate, real and/or sample home- and work-related forms using a variety of resources; e.g., Social Insurance Number (SIN) form, template on Human Resources Development Canada (HRDC) Web site, job application, bank account application and income tax template, computer-generated and/or other presentations to demonstrate the interview process, workplace task(s) and/or to provide other information and narrative, descriptive, persuasive and expository paragraphs and three- to five-paragraph essays appropriate to language growth for home, community and workplace applications

F680DEDCB08E47AFBB9036A7A4EA2C03.description: apply appropriate prewriting strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology, as appropriate, discussion, brainstorms, webs, outlines, journals and notes, to explore, develop and support their own and new ideas, opinions and points of view

B6158338E2D849AC8EEDAEA03CD0EC4E.description: create content appropriate to the purpose, audience, situation and medium and incorporate appropriate examples from their personal experience

F88EFA4F88B748BB8B308D8DD72550FD.description: take ownership of their text creation by selecting or crafting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful and engaging

FE9E62F6357840B29B9427019B3437CB.description: take ownership of their text creation by selecting or crafting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful and engaging

600B4A746CC748F68BB580FCE3A44EA6.description: apply common conventions when creating oral, print, visual and multimedia texts; e.g., volume of a multimedia presentation; format of letters, memorandums and e-mail messages; structure of a résumés

1EAFC9E7811742A9AC4CFE33B3320F89.description: use a medium appropriate to the content and context; e.g., television advertisement targeting specific audiences such as youth, men or women

45629C27616643F08DD2FA8DFF730A89.description: use structures consistent with the form, content and purpose; e.g., chronological order when creating a résumés, narrative or historical timeline; videotape an interview with a member of the business community or an employer

386747ED8BF14CDF83C7411C1ED35911.description: select a text form consistent with the purpose and content; e.g., photo essay in their career portfolio that includes work experience and other community partnerships

41772914EB644C10B3839BC650117CD6.description: Consider and address form, structure and medium

CD4BFE88C4244DF391FC57F548CDF6CE.description: recognize that the depth and breadth of content will affect the format, structure and medium

70BCAC8A4EA44D67A020D64002122429.description: identify the expectations and constraints of a communication; e.g., format, standards of quality, availability of resources and time

2424271ECF1A4A16821717A8816339C3.description: consider the audience factors that affect text creation; e.g., age, gender, audience size and proximity, culture and positions of authority

6D5BB0332BE14AA3B290404665BB4BC8.description: determine the purpose for text creation; e.g., to inform, explain, persuade, build relationships or entertain

CA85D747F123470A9B8827CBE553649F.description: Develop and present a variety of print and nonprint texts

B4F6A79F28094BAF85AFB37225696ABB.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to create oral, print, visual and multimedia texts and enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

B5CD7E06FC574DE2A15A6F3C76CB3D3A.description: develop a plan to enhance the craftsmanship and accuracy of current and future work and celebrate and take pride in their efforts and accomplishments

94622E1F46C9447A933ECF68578960C1.description: review the appropriateness, accuracy and significance of findings, conclusions and generalizations

E319027F5C4A4740B6062153694E8AFC.description: evaluate the effectiveness of the strategies used to guide the research process and identify strategies to improve future research

B07290A7DE6F4DBFA5AFAB5D20FBB205.description: Review inquiry or research process and findings

C6E86AB46FA04212A50F4D7C6ABF048E.description: use appropriate strategies, e.g., cause and effect, pros and cons, plus/minus/interesting (PMI), storyboards and Venn diagrams, when analyzing, synthesizing and evaluating information to draw conclusions or form generalizations

1F01D9A514EA43B9BD64F977E1CFE2AB.description: draw conclusions that are appropriate to their findings, reflect their own understandings and are consistent with the topic, purpose and situation

EE3AC16888C64655AD6962CF87FB39B9.description: distinguish between support and generalization and provide evidence for generalizations and conclusions

07490C4829914FC0AFCB140281CF47DF.description: form generalizations by integrating new information with prior knowledge

C05580C22C45443FB90DCA9432A4BA43.description: identify multiple viewpoints and evaluate the relevancy, quality, credibility and bias of sources and information

4584452901B647D7AF7817FB573D5FF5.description: assess whether the information gathered is reliable, complete, current and significant to determine its usefulness to the overall purpose, audience and form of the presentation

E7591ADF34D74BF4AC2BFA0DE4D5D2CB.description: assess whether information sources are credible and appropriate to the purpose, audience and form of the presentation

AA1CF3C7539A48AE99370692EDFD6475.description: apply guidelines for Internet use; e.g., confidentiality, respect copyright and use rules for citing sources

CE91A44CAC804AFE8867442709791003.description: record information accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

925DC7B9DBCB4CB39A77DD5EB85AD085.description: use and manage a variety of oral, print, visual and multimedia resources appropriate to a topic; e.g., textbooks, books, encyclopedias, graphs, diagrams, posters, pictures, films, databases, CD-ROMs, Web sites and the Internet

6A9927DA659F44D189C1460EFF2A16CC.description: identify and/or develop appropriate details to support the focus of an inquiry, using a variety of strategies; e.g., map/webs, graphic organizers and outlines

9F93BAE24CEF4C25B610DE4F22E56FFC.description: use a variety of strategies to organize and record information; e.g., take notes in point form, outlines, webs, categorize and guide questions

291570A155334163B3F7294EE8F9C8BE.description: select information and support materials appropriate to the purpose from a variety of print and nonprint sources, e.g., museums, government agencies, Elders, business people, periodicals, the Internet, CD-ROMs, television, radio and surveys, using a variety of strategies; e.g., skim and scan, view, question and interview

5B4B17512C9243EF90FCBAA25620EBED.description: identify potential strategies and technologies for gathering, generating and recording information; e.g., Web sites; encyclopedias; interviews; skim and scan; outlines; webs; identify key words, phrases and relevant information; take notes in point form

1EDA992E59B24587B498522F16332467.description: use questions, discussion, reflection and other appropriate strategies to guide and monitor an inquiry or research plan

E4C0034E8FBF400FA5BB44DAB3031654.description: create an inquiry or research plan, considering a variety of factors; e.g., breadth and depth of prior knowledge, information gaps, appropriate collection tools and format, sources of information, purpose, audience, time and potential presentation form

3E4490C2F4314B6F8B94DC844E8545FB.description: Plan an inquiry or research process and identify information needs and sources

5E57EC23FA2A479B917DBD47B1700F7A.description: refine the scope and direction of an inquiry by identifying the breadth and depth of the topic and the limitations, time availability, purpose, audience and form of presentation

7CFBEAC275164CD38F250C9FF45798C4.description: create categories or questions to guide an inquiry

FD9024474ABE466EA3A3C3BC42C3CC4B.description: establish a focus for text creation and determine the scope by identifying an effective, controlling idea, issue or question

DEC83DBB43994F35B0773B299488A13D.description: identify topics for research through a variety of strategies, e.g., discussion, brainstorms and webs, considering the audience, e.g., scope and potential presentation form, and the purpose; e.g., to inform, make decisions and persuade

5ECCC7525C45457F85EC128FD165088D.description: Focus on purpose and presentation form

C67C0577F6464B669F41CAC7C277E67E.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

75240B24A53442D0B48EBDFF5E0E2489.description: examine and appreciate how graphic design techniques, e.g., graphic quality, colour, sound, camera angle, lighting, composition and perspective, create and/or manipulate emotion, mood and point of view

F3144382045A4A2280D4FF02C070ACA9.description: examine and appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of techniques used in texts to present emotions, ideas and information and evoke response

CADB0FD8A22441EAB0692FD0A63413CC.description: Appreciate the effectiveness and artistry of print and nonprint texts

E47F96C8141B4CB5B59BBAB1A8E2A406.description: examine the images in print and nonprint texts in terms of created reality and appropriateness to purpose; e.g., sensationalizing portrayals of everyday life; representation of age/gender; use of pace, music and camera angles

0E1ED2B194D9440BA8765F8FD709894C.description: assess the settings and plots of texts in terms of created reality and plausibility

DCB7BD20AD9444B6A129FAB989A6B9A7.description: assess the appropriateness of their own and others' understandings and interpretations of texts by referring to specific evidence

E075ADFFD43A4CDC9C05AB0E12EE70BD.description: Evaluate the relationship to realism and the appropriateness and significance of print and nonprint texts

87F46DAD36F24893920A39D366F1C1F8.description: recognize Canadian content and portrayals of Canadian culture and society in print and nonprint texts

6982EAC0E88043E38702A1CF2A1D346A.description: compare the choices and motives of characters/people portrayed in print and nonprint texts with themselves and others and recognize that the choices and motives presented in texts may provide insight into the behaviours of themselves and others

B3BC6CF3DE354195B1C2F01A3430F6B0.description: identify and consider personal moral, ethical and cultural perspectives when studying texts and reflect on how perspectives may change as a result of interpretation and discussion

A0D8B4FDCD25489488914214D869528D.description: Connect themselves, text, culture and environment

96754CD533404E0E997943265B54DAC3.description: Respond to a variety of print and nonprint texts

721ACD21967545EA9B756DE095B86DDC.description: identify and examine reasons for, and effectiveness of, the elements, devices and techniques used in a variety of print and nonprint texts; e.g., advertisements, music videos, films, workplace documents and Web pages

A1D1C13C6D8D4680B9EB1D3274000994.description: recognize that elements of effective oral, visual and multimedia presentations, e.g., music, colour, lighting, movement, gesture, space and shape, are used to create specific effects

92B289F7B27D4F82908DD661551589ED.description: recognize the use of narrative hooks, foreshadowing, flashbacks, suspense and surprise endings to contribute to the effectiveness of plot development

F45526AA62FF401287D76AFCCDF5B93A.description: recognize the use of irony, humour, simile, metaphor, personification and symbols to contribute to a theme and to create a specific effect on the audience

222EB8C8E86642739A103E330D593BC6.description: Relate elements, devices and techniques to created effects

609B07DB78FE4D23A5897D4D91194BA6.description: identify organizational patterns and structural features that contribute to the purpose and content in common texts; e.g., headlines in newspapers; photographs in menus; text organizers such as tables of contents, indexes, headings and italic and boldface formatting

B63180AA40954B70ACE85FD4A2D7174D.description: recognize that some forms, structures and media are more appropriate than others in achieving a particular purpose with an intended audience; e.g., television and radio programs and advertisements use short time segments and pacing to gain and retain audience attention

84100942125F4401AC156EFBE1F5FD05.description: recognize that audience factors, e.g., gender and culture, influence form, structure and media

9BCCA9456775460C8B8C7C536EAC0D6C.description: identify common text forms and their purposes, including communication forms, e.g., letters, e-mail messages and memoranda, and literary forms; e.g., poems, narratives, dramatizations and oral stories

33644A682C2E444AB5948A5124B7349B.description: Relate form, structure and medium to purpose, audience and content

E47C0C5D727D43C7BB5CDFE4E531F164.description: Understand and appreciate textual forms, elements and techniques

DE963EEB46354EF28281A09B519E1BFE.description: use a variety of reference strategies and technologies to aid their understanding and create their own reference materials; e.g., take notes; use library catalogues; create a personalized dictionary, telephone/address books and a World Wide Web/URL address list

5BB06B1F377049A6826AD9BFCF25765A.description: record information sources in a bibliography or footnotes, accurately and completely, using a consistent and appropriate style

6C280C03F92141F0A63AE3ADF9F143E1.description: Use reference strategies and reference technologies

A400E4A66B134DF7B5D9D81389A9572D.description: recognize that past experiences influence their understandings and interpretations of texts

9F81672759D64F45B0983E750B58BAE1.description: relate their previous knowledge and experiences to enhance their understanding of new texts

14F6EBADF5B64BD9A3D3A95C3641A17D.description: identify visual elements, e.g., graphics, lists, graphs and charts, and the use of sound, e.g., music, sound effects and silence, and examine their contribution to the meaning of texts; e.g., the use of symbols and music in advertising by sports teams and food outlets

E9DAE4A75D8E44D982B30AD08BB72497.description: differentiate between literal and figurative statements and/or representations, describe images developed in texts, recognize imagery in a variety of texts, e.g., advertising, comic strips, comedy in television and movies, popular music, and recognize the meaning and purpose of these statements, representations and images

4A5533B0150D4E5B9F5AC727BA85F84D.description: identify nonverbal cues that support a speaker's intent; e.g., gestures and facial expressions

776FA0AD792940809D0C8B779A7ECEAD.description: determine a speaker's intent by identifying mood indicators; e.g., volume, tone, irony and sarcasm

0EF9C07362AE48ACB5D32FDB4203E7AA.description: paraphrase directions or messages to enhance their comprehension and complete tasks; e.g., oral directions at the workplace, assignments, manuals, diagrams, forms, lists and labels

83C3854BE2E64277915DF4E7251285BE.description: apply appropriate vocabulary strategies to enhance their comprehension of oral, print and multimedia texts; e.g., word attack skills, contextual clues and dictionary skills

3C5F6C29A0A94CE58572E11295EDAA21.description: identify and examine change in a character as a result of an event within a plot by examining elements of character, e.g., personality traits, motivation, relationships, attitudes, values, consistency of behaviour and plausibility of change, and relate a character's behaviour to their own personal experience, as appropriate

ADBF767307E8458B9EE2B24E079C0556.description: recognize the relationships among plot, setting, character and conflict by relating to prior knowledge, personal experience and new ideas

061A5BA463E5466697430B85DD47DBC6.description: categorize parts of a plot using a variety of strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology as appropriate, including introduction, characters, setting, initial incident, rising action, climax, falling action and resolution, and assess the effectiveness of those strategies in relation to the purpose and audience

B535C36E15304BF4A0C03F76FC71570C.description: summarize the controlling idea, supporting ideas, details and conflicts in a text to enhance understanding

4B89AB005A4641D29E69450D43E0B4B6.description: use a variety of appropriate reading strategies to enhance their comprehension of print texts; e.g., skim; read out loud; reread; form questions; make predictions; use contextual clues, graphic organizers and summarization

92DB02F081C04160BFE8F371C05140D7.description: recognize the impact that personal contexts, e.g., experience and prior knowledge, have on the construction of meaning in a text

917FB5699D314DA683C71BE6974753A6.description: use references to gain the historical and societal background and to enhance their understanding of specific texts; e.g., personal experiences, community leaders, teachers and Elders

BCB7991D0313453BB5129B85A6DAAB0D.description: recognize that a variety of factors influence the creation of texts; e.g., constraints of time and space, audience, culture, societal norms and historical background

F2960F1BAABE48898772B68B1EDE532E.description: identify the key messages and features of a text that provide information about the creator's purpose and intended audience; e.g., the use of jargon, idioms, specialized workplace terminology and illustrations

8998EF8AAC0A43C0B5A6D99B70E3A59D.description: examine a variety of texts and identify their audience and purpose for creation to inform, persuade, entertain or inspire; e.g., advertisements, instruction manuals, newspapers, magazines, Web sites, CD-ROMs, music lyrics and documentary dramas

86A15F0E24D8404CBB4E828BFD2C9337.description: Construct meaning from text and context

59CE2069B0DC409C83169641F4DD9CD0.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

C423D356389F4770864EB75CBC902160.description: demonstrate a willingness to continuously learn and grow as effective communicators

D3E156941AE0470DB684325AD492404C.description: apply strategies to increase their personal potential; e.g., set short- and long-term goals, create an action plan and build a career portfolio

858D7A01893F47FD94725354B7A4266A.description: create a plan to enhance language learning based on their personal goals and in relation to everyday home, community and workplace communication

5D071A7E3AAE411EA4B3B3C77C548B7F.description: investigate and evaluate the language skills required to achieve attainable secondary, post-secondary and career goals, using appropriate strategies and resources; e.g., Web sites such as the Alberta Learning Information Service (ALIS) and the National Occupational Classification (NOC) system

36671015AB9D4EF78E2503F91985BAE1.description: use guided peer and/or self-evaluation to assess their strengths and areas needing improvement, using a variety of strategies; e.g., checklists, skills inventories and discussion

9705F915165F4AC78AC328214F38DE73.description: Set personal goals for language growth

941F03F59F43470B99EF650CFC8BF660.description: explore and assess a range of print and nonprint texts to expand their interests, including those used in the community and the workplace; e.g., newspapers, live drama, workplace/community health information manuals and product promotional materials

BBC91B79374942E481A78D5842BDA948.description: select and apply strategies to expand their interests in various text creations, e.g., Web sites, advertising and promotional texts, workplace manuals, CD-ROMs, movies and music videos, including the use of language, image, sound and structure

4BA31967494D4AED8652B3AB0F0C6486.description: apply strategies to expand their interests in print and nonprint texts and text creators; e.g., sharing reading/viewing/listening inventories, discuss the role marketing plays in shaping popular culture, visit a museum or a community cultural or art centre

1982E4149ED94693B75299BBA505CF3A.description: identify and examine the personal text preferences and other factors influencing personal preferences; e.g., purpose, interest, peers, family, heritage, advertisements and technology

9CBC89B417CD42F9803319D825F7B2C2.description: consider the ideas, perspectives and interpretations of others to broaden understandings

A841377C6C4740EB91B13A15DE4C18F3.description: examine personal responses to new perspectives and identify factors that have influenced responses

712261240063401DB04FCAC211DEC12D.description: experiment with a variety of strategies, activities and resources to explore ideas, observations, opinions, experiences and emotions; e.g., exploratory talk; keep a journal; take part in a sharing circle; interview a member of the community, a local employer or a coworker

2EFBDC8E1F7E4107A77AB5E8D5AD2EB4.description: experiment with language, image and structure to create different effects for specific purposes and audiences; e.g., when creating components of a career portfolio, preparing a visual representation or completing workplace tasks

2263BC365C7D448EA3734F4F243B0DC5.description: Experiment with language, image and structure

6EDF146A295F4A02A0FE0D65CFE8F760.description: form and communicate tentative understandings, interpretations and positions on ideas and information presented in print and nonprint texts through discussion or by using various communication technologies; e.g., telephone and e-mail

12D9B191E81C4061810FE5F07328464E.description: experiment with strategies that contribute to the formation of tentative understandings, interpretations and positions; e.g., pose questions, discuss, keep an open mind, reread, review and recognize that texts may be inaccurate or misleading

1E615522D31143089B57F92735EE9724.description: Form tentative understandings, interpretations and positions

31294A7562EC48FD91C94D764C385102.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
